intro: Adenocarpus vallisoletanus, commonly known as the Andes burr, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, woody pods that contain the seeds. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Adenocarpus vallisoletanus plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
